etymology.description: 长(長) (cháng, "long") and 城(城) (chéng, "wall; city wall") combine to refer to the Great Wall of China.
etymology.interpretation: 长城(長城) (Chángchéng, "Great Wall") describes the long fortifications built to protect the Chinese states against invasions and raids. The word literally means 'long wall,' highlighting its extensive structure.

examples.chinese: 长城坚不可摧(長城堅不可摧)。
游客登上长城(遊客登上長城)，感受历史沧桑(感受歷史滄桑)。
examples.pinyin: Yóukè dēng shàng Chángchéng, gǎn shòu lìshǐ cāngsāng.
examples.english: Tourists climb the Great Wall and experience the vicissitudes of history.

examples.chinese: 长城雄伟壮丽(長城雄偉壯麗)。
examples.english: The Great Wall is majestic and magnificent.
